awd_titl_txt: Ultrafine Condensation Nucleus Counter for Stratospheric    Pressures
awd_abstract_narration: The objective of this work is to design a condensation nucleus             counter capable of counting particles as small as 0.003 um at                   pressures ranging from 10 to 1000 mbar.  The heat and mass transfer             processes in the condensation nucleus counter will be modeled                   numerically.  Condensational droplet growth with heat dissipation               will be modelled analytically.  The model will be verified to the               extent possible by comparison with existing models and data from a              condensation nucleus counter which has been used for stratospheric              particle measurements.  Model results will be used to design an                 improved condensation nucleus counter.  Parameters to be optimized              include flow rates, working fluid, condenser and saturator                      temperatures and condenser length.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Technology, Innovation, and Partnerships
